result.execSummary:
The defendant John S. Knudtson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John S. Knudtson in court with attorney Kirk William Everson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement has been reached and stated on record. Attorney Everson concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & No Contest to Count 4.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 & 3. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Everson. Statement by the defendant. Statement by the Court prior to sentence.  Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: COUNT 1- 5 months WCJ with Huber, No Good Time Credit. 4 days credit Time Served. To begin no later than June 23, 2015. CONDITIONS on both Counts:   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant John S. Knudtson in court, in custody, appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Family memebers state counsel from Green Bay has been retained.  Def confirms he wants to seek counsel.  Court will proceed with that understanding.  Def may also wish SPD for some of issues relating to this case.  DA argues for $500 cash bond w/conditions.  Def makes statement as to bond request, hoping for Signature Bond.  The Court:  Orders $5000 Signature Bond.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
